poem:
The Unseen Queue  

In the quiet margins of forms,  
names drift like forgotten leaves,  
and lives, stark in their slender threads,  
dissolve into bureaucratic silence.  
A pen poised, suspended above  
the chasm's edge—what if  
we'd noticed the paper's whisper,  
heard it speak of halved breaths,  
before they joined the autumn air?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Deaths prompt MPs to call for better support for vulnerable benefit claimants A cross-party committee of MPs has called for greater protections for vulnerable benefit claimants after hundreds of cases of deaths and serious harms linked to safeguarding failures by welfare officials. The work and pensions select committee said many of these cases, which include instances where claimants took their own lives, could have been prevented had the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) discharged". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Deaths prompt MPs to call for better support for vulnerable benefit claimants A cross-party committee of MPs has called for greater protections for vulnerable benefit claimants after hundreds of cases of deaths and serious harms linked to safeguarding failures by welfare officials. The work and pensions select committee said many of these cases, which include instances where claimants took their own lives, could have been prevented had the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) discharged
